a.span: M - Relations With Other Education Agencies

p.font: Grab N Go Meals provided April 6th -May 15th to any Rawlins County families with children age 1-18. Please call the District Hotline to request meals 785-513-5005 between 9:00am-10:00am each day. Please check the calendar to keep up-to-date on events. Go Buffs!

h3.a: A Message From Your School Counselor

div.p: Hello! I hope this message finds you all safe and well! I would like to reach out to those that are feeling stress/anxiety due to the circumstances we are in during these uncertain times. If a student or his/her family is in need of my services, please email me at mlohoefener@usd105.org This is for any student Kindergarten through 12 th grade. Many times a young person just needs reassurance and someone to listen to them . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about A Message From Your School Counselor

h3.a: Grab N Go Meals provided April 6 - May 15

div.p: Rawlins County USD 105 will begin providing free Grab N Go meals on Monday, April 6 th for children ages 1 to 18. This program will run through May 15 th . There will be three pick-up sites for these meals, including the east side of the high school (pull into the parking lot traveling south to north), west side of the elementary school (traveling south to north), and in front of the post office in Herndon. Pick-up . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Grab N Go Meals provided April 6 - May 15

div.p: RCHS Yearbook class wanted to let you know that we are still going to have a 2019-2020 yearbook. It will be a special one with everything that is happening. We are extending the deadline to order to May 4th and you can order online now. If you would rather order with a check, you will need to get an order form from the school office or Mrs. Popp can put one in her mailbox. Just let us know what . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about RCHS Yearbook Information & Order Form

h3.a: RCES Continuous Learning School Supply Pick-up tonight March 28th

div.p:
Dear RCES families,
As most of you have seen, we will be under a stay at home order very shortly. Due to this, our supply distribution has been moved to TONIGHT from 4pm-6pm. We will make arrangements for those who can not make it in the coming days, as we realize this will be difficult for some. Also understand that we may not have all supplies at this time. We will work through other supplies as it is . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about RCES Continuous Learning School Supply Pick-up tonight March 28th

h3.a: March 26, 2020 Special Board Meeting Public Access Via Zoom

div.p:
Due to the COVID-19 mass gathering limitations of 10 people or less, only school board members and administration personnel will be present in person at the meeting. Below is the option for any patron to join and view the meeting via zoom. Click 'read more' for full details.
Join Zoom Meeting https://zoom.us/j/604950859
Meeting ID: 604 950 859
All microphones will be muted upon entry . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about March 26, 2020 Special Board Meeting Public Access Via Zoom

div.p:
3/18/2020 Update
We are finishing day 1 after Governor Kelly’s announcement to close Kansas school buildings. It is important to point out that the governor did not cancel school for the year. Buildings are closed for a period of time to permit custodial staff the opportunity to do a deep clean and sanitation of school district buildings. USD 105 is in the process of the sanitation process. . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Update 3/18/2020

h3.a: All school facilities closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year

div.p:
Today, March 17, 2020 Governor Laura Kelly announced all school facilities will be closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. This will place tremendous hardship on our families and staff, and impact the social and emotional well-being of our students.
We have been working on contingency plans since mid-March, including how we can meet the ongoing learning needs of our students and provide breakfast and lunch for . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about All school facilities closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year

Sunny, with a high near 83. South wind 5 to 10 mph increasing to 10 to 15 mph in the afternoon.
